</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT;TEXT-INDENT: -24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 15PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted EBITDA are non-GAAP financial measures. For a reconciliation of these measures to an equivalent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	GAAP measure, see pages 36-38
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	herein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our sales were $4,529
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million for the year ended December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	31, 2015 as compared to $5,933
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million for the year ended December 31, 2014. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,404
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	mil
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	lion decrease reflected a $162
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million impact of the decline in foreign currencies in areas where we operate compared to the U.S. dollar.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	U.S. Segment&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our U.S. sales decreased $855 million to $3,572
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for 2015 from $4,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	427
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for 2014. This 19% decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	reflected a $659 million, or 36%, decrease in the upstream sector, a $167 million, or 10%, decrease in the midstream sector and a modest decline in the downstream sector.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decline in all sectors reflects the decrease in customer spending related to the decline in oil and natural gas prices and the resulting decline in rig count.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Canadian Segment&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Canadian sales decreased $300 million to $333 million for 2015 from $633
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	This 47
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decrease reflected a $276 million, or 53%, decrease in upstream business due to a decrease in customer spending.&nbsp;&nbsp;Approximately $51&nbsp;million, or 17%, of the total decline was a result of the weaker Canadian dollar relative to the U.S. dollar.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	International Segment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#x2014;Our Inte
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	rnational sales decreased $249 million to $624 million for 2015 from $873
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million for 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	This 29
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	% decrease reflected the combined impact of lower project activity and deferral of MRO expenditures particularly in Norway, the U.K., Australia and the Netherlands. The decrease in sales included the impact of the decline in the foreign currencies in areas where we operate compared to the U.S. dollar, which accounted for $111 million, or 45%, of the total decline
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Gross Profit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;Our gro
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ss profit was $786
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million (17.4% of sales) for the year ended December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	31, 2015 as compared to $1,018
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million (17.2% of sales) for the year ended December 31, 2014. Gross profit for 2015 benefited from lower product costs reflected in our last-in first-out (&#x201C;LIFO&#x201D;) inventory costing methodology.&nbsp;&nbsp;LIFO resulted in a red
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	uction in cost of sales of $53
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million in 2015 as compared to an in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	crease in cost of sales of $12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excluding the impact of LIFO, gross profit declined 120 basis points primarily as the result of the impact of customer pricing pressures related to the decline in oil prices and sales mix changes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Certain purchasing costs and warehousing activities (including receiving, inspection, and stocking costs), as well as general warehousing expenses, are included in selling, general and administrative expenses and not in cost of sales. As such, our gross profit may not be comparable to others who may include these expenses as a component of costs of goods sold. Purchasing and warehousing act
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ivities costs approximated $37 million and $46
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	35
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Adjusted Gross Profit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;Adjusted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Gross Profit decreased to $814
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million (18.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	%&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of&nbsp;sales)&nbsp;for 2015 from $1,120
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million (18.9% of sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) for 2014, a decrease of $306
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million. Adjusted Gross Profit is a non-GAAP financial measure. We define Adjusted Gross Profit as sales, less cost of sales, plus depreciation and amortization, plus amortization of intangibles, and plus or minus the impact of our LIFO inventory costing methodology. We present Adjusted Gross Profit because we believe it is a useful indicator of our operating performance without regard to items, such as amortization of intangibles, that can vary substantially from company to company depending upon the nature and extent of acquisitions they have been involved in. Similarly, the impact of the LIFO inventory costing method can cause results to vary substantially from company to company depending upon whether they elect to utilize LIFO and depending upon which method they may elect. We use Adjusted Gross Profit as a key performance indicator in managing our business. We believe that gross profit is the financial measure calculated and presented in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles that is most directly comparable to Adjusted Gross Profit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following table reconciles Adjusted Gross Profit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, a non-GAAP financial measure,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	with our gross profit, as derived from our consolidated financial statements (in millions):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

	of Revenue
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:03.24%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:13.94%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.5PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:03.24%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0.05PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Selling, General and Administrative (&#x201C;SG&amp;A&#x201D;) Expenses

	.

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;million (13.4% of sales) for the year ended December 31, 2015 as comp

	ared to $716

	million (12.1% of sales) for the year ended December 31, 2014.&nbsp;

	ur 2015 SG&amp;A expenses were $14

	eduction efforts as well as $5

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	e amounts, SG&amp;A decr
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	eased $115
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million.&nbsp;&nbsp;Approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$37 million of the decrease was due to the impact of weaker foreign currencies in the countries in which we operate relative to the U.S. dollar.&nbsp;&nbsp;The remaining decrease was attributable to volume-related declines and the cost reduction efforts we have made
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Goodwill and Intangibles Asset Impairment.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In December 2015, because of the continued decline in commodity prices and activity levels, we performed an assessment of current market conditions and our future long-term expectations of oil and gas markets and concluded it was more likely than not that the fair values of our reporting units were lower than their carrying values.&nbsp; Our assessment took into consideration, among other things, significant further reductions in projected spending by our customers in 2016 and a more pessimistic long-term outlook for the price of oil and natural gas, and the resulting impact on our 2016 budget and long-term financial forecast.&nbsp;&nbsp; As a result of this assessment, we completed an interim goodwill impairment test as of December 31, 2015.&nbsp; This test resulted i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	n an impairment charge of $292 million comprised of $109
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million in ou
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	r U.S. reporting unit and $183
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million in our International reporting unit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As a result of these same factors, we performed impairment tests of other intangible assets as well and incur
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	red impairment charges of $128
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million related to our indefinite-lived trade name w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ithin our U.S. segment and $42
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million related to the customer base intangible assets within our International segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:7PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>

	was a result of lower sales offset by corresponding reductions in SG&amp;A. Severance expenses negatively i

	mpacted operating income by $7 million and $3

<P STYLE="MARGIN:7PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Interest Expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;Our interest expense was $48
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for the year ended Decemb
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	er 31, 2015 as compared to $62
</FONT>

	&nbsp;million for the year ended December 31, 2014.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The decrease can be attributed to lower average debt levels in 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2015, total debt was reduced by $930 million with $355 million of net proceeds from our June 2015 Preferred Stock issuance combined with positive cash flows from operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:7PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	.

	million for the year en

	ded December 31, 2015 from $14

	In 2

</FONT>

	million of expense related to our disposit
</FONT>

	ion of the OCTG business, a $3

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

	he 2015 expenses included a $3

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Income Tax Benefit (Expense)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our income tax benefit was $11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for the year ended December 31, 2015, as co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	mpared to expense of $82
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million for the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our effective tax rates were 3% and 36
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	% for the years ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014, respectively. These rates generally differ from the U.S. federal statutory rate of 35% as a result of state income taxes and differing, generally lower, foreign income tax rates. The change in the effective income tax rate between fiscal year 2015 and 2014 was primarily due to a non-tax deductible goodwill impairment charge during the last quarter of 2015, tax expense during fiscal year 2015 related to provision for valuation allowances and the mix of income and losses in the various tax jurisdictions in which we operate.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net (Loss) Income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;Our net loss was $331
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for the year ended December 31, 2015 as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared to net income of $144
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million for the year ended Decembe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	r 31, 2014, a decrease of $475
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Adjusted EBITDA
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; Adjusted EBITDA, a non-GA
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	AP financial measure, was $235
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million for the year ended December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	31, 2015, as compared to $424
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million for the year ended December 31, 2014. Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Adjusted EBITDA decreased $189
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million over that period primarily as a result of the factors noted above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We define Adjusted EBITDA as net income plus interest, income taxes, depreciation and amortization, amortization of intangibles and certain other expenses, including non-cash expenses, (such as equity-based compensation, severance and restructuring, changes in the fair value of derivative instruments and asset impairments, including inventory) and plus or minus the impact of our LIFO inventory costing methodology.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We believe Adjusted EBITDA provides investors a helpful measure for comparing our operating performance with the performance of other companies that have different financing and capital structures or tax rates. We believe that net income is the financial measure calculated and presented in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles that is most directly comparable to Adjusted EBITDA.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

	O

	perating Activities

<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	provided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	operating activities was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	253
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million in 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	compared to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	690
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	provided by operations in 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The decrease in cash provided by operations was primarily the result of reduced profitability combined with a reduction in the pace of working capital contraction in response to slowing sales.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Excluding cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, working capital
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6 (from 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) as compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a decrease of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	588
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5 (from 2014)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The current year decline in working capital was impacted most significantly by a $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	141
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	128
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million reduction in inventory and accounts receivable, respectively, caused by declining sales levels.&nbsp;&nbsp;We continue to actively manage our working capital to an appropriate level given current market conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net cash provided by operating activities was $690 million in 2015 compared to $106&nbsp;million used in operations in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The $796&nbsp;million increase in net cash provided by operations was primarily the result of reduced working capital requirements.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excluding the impact of acquisitions, working capital decreased $543 million in 2015 (from 2014) as compared to an increase of $289 million in 2014 (from 2013).&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	decline in working capital was impacted most significantly by a $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	419 million and $412
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million reduction in inventory and accounts receivable, respectively, caused by declining sales levels.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:13.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:10.8PT 0PT 4.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our primary sources of liquidity consist of cash generated from our operating activities, existing cash balances and borrowings under our existing Global ABL Facility.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At Decembe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	r 31, 2016, our total liquidity, including cash on hand, was $534 million.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our ability to generate sufficient cash flows from our operating activities is primarily dependent on our sales of products to our customers at profits sufficient to cover our fixed and variable expenses. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December 31, 2016 and 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we h
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ad cash and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	cash equivalents o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	f $109
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	69
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million, respectively. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December 31, 2016 and 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	61
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and $51
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million of our cash and cash equivalents were maintained in the accounts of our various foreign subsidiaries and, if those amounts were transferred among countries or repatriated to the U.S., those amounts may be subject to additional tax liabilities, which would be recognized in our financial statements in the period during which the transfer decision was made. We currently have the intent and ability to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	indefinitely
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	reinvest the cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	held by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	our foreign subsidiaries
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and there are currently no plans for the repatriation of those amounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:10.8PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	primary
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	credit facilities consist of a seven-year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Term Loan maturing in November 2019 with an ori
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ginal principal amount of $794
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million and a five-year $1.05 billion Global ABL Facility that provides a $977 million facility in the United States, a $30&nbsp;million facility in Norway, a $20 million facility in Canada, a $10 million facility in Australia, a $5 million facility in the United Kingdom, a $4 million facility in the Netherlands and a $4 million facility in Belgium.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Global ABL matures in July 2019.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Global ABL Facility contains an accordion feature that allows us to increase the principal amount of the facility by up to $300
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million, subject to additional lender com
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	mitments. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	we had no outstanding borrowings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$425
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	E
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	xcess
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	vailability
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, as defined
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;u
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	nder this Global ABL Facility.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Availability is dependent on a borrowing base comprised of a percentage of eligible accounts receivable and inventory which is subject to redetermination from time to time.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of December 31, 2016, there was $414 million outstanding under the Term Loan, which matures on November 9, 2019.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our credit ratings are below &#x201C;investment grade&#x201D; and, as such, could impact both our ability to raise new funds as well as the interest rates on our future borrowings. Our existing obligations restrict our ability to incur additional debt. We were in compliance with the covenants contained in our various credit facilities as of and during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We believe our sources of liquidity will be sufficient to satisfy the anticipated cash requirements associated with our existing operations for at least the next twelve months. However, our future cash requirements could be higher than we currently expect as a result of various factors. Additionally, our ability to generate sufficient cash from our operating activities depends on our future performance, which is subject to general economic, political, financial, competitive and other factors beyond our control. We may from time to time seek to raise additional debt or equity financing in the public or private markets, based on market conditions. There can be no assurance that we will be able to raise any such financing on terms acceptable to us or at all. We may also seek, from time to time, depending on market conditions, to refinance certain categories of our debt, and we may seek to consummate equity offerings. Any such transaction would be subject to market conditions, compliance with all of our credit agreements, and various other factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November 2015, the Company&#x2019;s board of directors authorized a share repurchase program for common stock up to $100&nbsp;million, which was increased in November 2016 to $125 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;The program is scheduled to expire on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2017.&nbsp;&nbsp;The shares may be repurchased at management&#x2019;s discretion in the open market.&nbsp;&nbsp;Depending on market conditions and other factors, these repurchases may be commenced or suspended from time to time without prior notice.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016, we purchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6,861,191
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of common
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	stock at a total cost of $95
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million.&nbsp;&nbsp;In total under this p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	lan, we have purchased 7,677,580 shares at a total cost of $107
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_16"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Contractual Obligations, Commitments and Contingencies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Contractual Obligations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:3PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following table summarizes our minimum payment obligations as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	relating to long-term debt, interest payments, capital leases, operating leases, purchase obligations and other long-term liabilities for the periods indicated (in millions):

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term debt is based on debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	outstanding at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT;TEXT-INDENT: -24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest payments are based on interest rate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	s in effect at December&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and assume contractual amortization payments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT;TEXT-INDENT: -24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purchase obligations reflect our commitments to purchase PVF products in the ordinary course of business. While our vendors often allow us to cancel these purchase orders without penalty, in certain cases cancellations may subject us to cancellation fees or penalties, depending on the terms of the contract.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We historically have been an acquisitive company. We expect to fund future acquisitions primarily from (i)&nbsp;borrowings, either the unused portion of our facilities or new debt issuances, (ii)&nbsp;cash provided by operations, or (iii)&nbsp;the issuance of additional equity in connection with the acquisitions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:13.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Other Commitments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In the normal course of business with customers, vendors and others, we are contingently liable for performance under standby letters of credit and bid, performance and surety bonds. We were contingently liable for approximately $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	61
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million of standby letters of credit, trade guarantees that banks issue and bid, and performance and surety bonds at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Management does not expect any material amounts to be drawn on these instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:13.75PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Legal Proceedings
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Asbestos Claims.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; We are one of many defendants in lawsuits that plaintiffs have brought seeking damages for personal injuries that exposure to asbestos allegedly caused. Plaintiffs and their family members have brought these lawsuits against a large volume of defendant entities as a result of the various defendants&#x2019; manufacture, distribution, supply or other involvement with asbestos, asbestos-containing products or equipment or activities that allegedly caused plaintiffs to be exposed to asbestos. These plaintiffs typically assert exposure to asbestos as a consequence of third-party manufactured products that the Company&#x2019;s subsidiary,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	MRC Global (US) Inc.,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	purportedly dist
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ributed. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we are a named defendant in approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	510
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	lawsuits involving approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,130
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	claims.&nbsp;&nbsp;No asbestos lawsuit has resulted in a judgment against us to date, with the majority being settled, dismissed or otherwise resolved. Applicable third-party insurance has substantially covered these claims, and insurance should continue to cover a substantial majority of existing and anticipated future claims. Accordingly, we have recorded a liability for our estimate of the most likely settlement of asserted claims and a related receivable from insurers for our estimated recovery, to the extent we believe that the amounts of recovery are probable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We annually conduct analyses of our asbestos-related litigation to estimate the adequacy of the reserve for pending and probable asbestos-related claims. Given these estimated reserves and existing insurance coverage that has been available to cover substantial portions of these claims, we believe that our current accruals and associated estimates relating to pending and probable asbestos-related litigation likely to be asserted over the next 15 years are currently adequate. This belief, however, relies on a number of assumptions, including:&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	That our future settlement payments, disease mix and dismissal rates will be materially consistent with historic experience;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	That insurance recoveries for settlement payments and defense costs will be materially consistent with historic experience;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	That legal standards (and the interpretation of these standards) applicable to asbestos litigation will not change in material respects;
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	That there are no materially negative developments in the claims pending against us; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:CALIBRI;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	That key co-defendants in current and future claims remain solvent.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	If any of these assumptions prove to be materially different in light of future developments, liabilities related to asbestos-related litigation may be materially different than amounts accrued or estimated. Further, while we anticipate that additional claims will be filed in the future, we are unable to predict with any certainty the number, timing and magnitude of such future claims. In our opinion, there are no pending legal proceedings that are likely to have a material adverse effect on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Other Legal Claims and Proceedings.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	From time to time, we have been subject to various claims and involved in legal proceedings incidental to the nature of our businesses. We maintain insurance coverage to reduce financial risk associated with certain of these claims and proceedings. It is not possible to predict the outcome of these claims and proceedings. However,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	n our opinion, there are no pending legal proceedings that are likely to have a material adverse effect on our co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	nsolidated financial statements. See also &#x201C;Note&nbsp;16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2014;Commitments and Contingencies&#x201D; to the audited consolidated financial st
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	atements as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Product Claims.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	From time to time, in the ordinary course of our business, our customers may claim that the products that we distribute are either defective or require repair or replacement under warranties that either we or the manufacturer may provide to the customer. These proceedings are, in the opinion of management, ordinary and routine matters incidental to our normal business. Our purchase orders with our suppliers generally require the manufacturer to indemnify us against any product liability claims, leaving the manufacturer ultimately responsible for these claims. In many cases, state, provincial or foreign law provides protection to distributors for these sorts of claims, shifting the responsibility to the manufacturer. In some cases, we could be required to repair or replace the products for the benefit of our customer and seek our recovery from the manufacturer for our expense. In our opinion, there are no pending legal proceedings that are likely to have a material adverse effect on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Weatherford Claim.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	In addition to PVF, our Canadian subsidiary, Midfield Supply (&#x201C;Midfield&#x201D;), now known as MRC Canada, also distributed progressive cavity pumps and related equipment (&#x201C;PCPs&#x201D;) under a distribution agreement with Weatherford Canada Partnership (&#x201C;Weatherford&#x201D;) within a certain geographical area located in southern Alberta, Canada.&nbsp;&nbsp;Commencing in late 2005 and into early 2006, Midfield hired new employees, including individuals who left Weatherford, as part of Midfield&#x2019;s desire to expand its PVF business into northern Alberta.&nbsp;&nbsp;Shortly thereafter, many of these employees left Midfield and formed a PCP manufacturing, distribution and service company named Europump Systems Inc. (&#x201C;Europump&#x201D;) in 2006.&nbsp;&nbsp;The distribution agreement with Weatherford expired in 2006.&nbsp;&nbsp;Midfield supplied Europump with PVF products that Europump distributed along with sales of PCP pumps.&nbsp;&nbsp;In April 2007, Midfield purchased Europump&#x2019;s distribution branches and began distributing and servicing Europump PCPs.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2014, the Company divested its PCP business to Europump, which Halliburton Corporation subsequently purchased.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Pursuant to a complaint that Weatherford filed on April 11, 2006 in the Court of Queen&#x2019;s Bench of Alberta, Judicial Bench of Edmonton (Action No. 060304628), Weatherford sued Europump, three of Europump&#x2019;s part suppliers, Midfield, certain current and former employees of Midfield, as well as other entities related to these parties, asserting a host of claims including breach of contract, breach of fiduciary duty, misappropriation of confidential information related to the PCPs, unlawful interference with economic relations and conspiracy.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company denies these allegations and contends that Midfield&#x2019;s expansion and subsequent growth was the result of fair competition.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	From 2006 through 2012, the case focused largely on Weatherford&#x2019;s questioning of defense witnesses.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2013, the defendants began substantive questioning of Weatherford and its witnesses.&nbsp;&nbsp;Discovery is ongoing and expected to last through early 2017.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In April 2016, the court dismissed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	suppliers from the case.&nbsp;&nbsp;Weatherford has appealed this dismissal.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The case is scheduled for trial in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	March 2018.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	While the Company believes Weatherford&#x2019;s claims are without merit and we intend to defend against them vigorously, in November 2015, the Company filed with the Court a formal offer of settlement for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million plus one half of the Weatherford party&#x2019;s costs and interest under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Judgment Interest Act
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Weatherford declined to accept the offer.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of December 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company had recorded a reserve of $3 million associated with this claim.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#xFEFF;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	41
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We do not have any material &#x201C;off-balance sheet arrangements&#x201D; as such term is defined within the rules and regulations of the SEC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:13.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Critical Accounting Estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We prepare our consolidated financial statements in accordance with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	U.S. generally accepted accounting principles
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. To apply these principles, management must make judgments and assumptions and develop estimates based on the best available information at the time. Actual results may differ based on the accuracy of the information utilized and subsequent events. The notes to our audited financial statements included elsewhere in this report describe our accounting policies. These critical accounting policies could materially affect the amounts recorded in our financial statements. We believe the following describes significant judgments and estimates used in the preparation of our consolidated financial statements:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inventories
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	U.S.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	inventories are valued at the lower of cost (principally using the LIFO method) or market. We record an estimate each quarter, if necessary, for the expected annual effect of inflation and estimated year-end inventory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	balance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. These estimates are adjusted to actual results determined at year-end. Our inventories that are held
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	outside of the U.S., totaling $164
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million and $242&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively, were valued at the lower of weighted-average cost or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	estimated net realizable value
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Under the LIFO inventory valuation method, changes in the cost of inventory are recognized in cost of sales in the current period even though these costs may have been incurred at significantly different values. Since the Company values most of its inventory using the LIFO inventory costing methodology, a rise in inventory costs has a negative effect on operating results, while, conversely, a fall in inventory costs results in a benefit to operating results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We determine reserves for inventory based on historical usage of inventory on-hand, assumptions about future demand and market conditions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Customers rely on the company to stock specialized items for certain projects and other needs.&nbsp;&nbsp;Therefore, the estimated carrying value of inventory depends upon demand driven by oil and gas spending activity, which in turn depends on oil and gas prices, the general outlook for economic growth worldwide, political stability in major oil and gas producing areas, and the potential obsolescence of various inventory items we sell.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Because of the sustained low oil and gas prices,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	we incurred inventory-related charges totaling $45 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	during the third quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	These charges reflect adjustments necessary to reduce the carrying value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	certain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	products determined to be excess or obsolete to their estimated net realizable value based on our cu
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	rrent market outlook for those
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	products.&nbsp;&nbsp;This amount includes $24 million in the International segment primarily related to a restructuring of our Australian business a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	nd market conditions in Iraq.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	eserves for excess and obsolete inventory were increased in the U.S. and Canada by $16 million and $5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:7PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Goodwill and Intangible Assets:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We record goodwill and intangible assets in conjunction with acquisitions that we make
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	hese assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	comprise 41% of our total assets as of December 31, 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;We record goodwill as the excess of cost over the fair valu
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	e of net assets that we acquire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;We record intangible assets at fair value at the date of acquisition and amortize the value of intangible assets over the assets&#x2019; estimated useful lives unless we determine that an asset has an indefinite life.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We make significant judgments and estimates in both calculating the fair value of these assets and determining their estimated useful lives.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The carrying values of our goodwill and intangible assets, by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	reporting unit
</FONT>

</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:7PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Impairment of Long-Lived Assets:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:7PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our long-lived assets consist primarily of:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:20PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:20PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	customer base intangibles; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:21PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:21PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	property, plant and equipment.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:LINE-THROUGH;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:7PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	The carrying value of these assets is subject to an impairment test when circumstances indicate a possible impairment.&nbsp;&nbsp;These circumstances would include significant decreases in our operating results and significant changes in market demand for our products and services. When
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	events and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	circumstances indicate a possible impairment, we assess recoverability from future operations using an undiscounted cash flow analysis, derived from the lowest appropriate asset group.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the carrying value exceeds the undiscounted cash flows, we would recognize an impairment charge to the extent that the carrying value exceeds the fair value.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	42
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage46"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We group customer base
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	intangible assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	on a basis consistent with our reporting units.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We determine the fair value of customer base intangibles
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	using a discounted cash flow analysis.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most significant factor in the determination of the fair value of our customer base intangibles is forecasted sales to our customers including, in particular, our largest customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Possible indicators of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	impairment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	could include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	prolonged decline in commodity oil and natural gas prices,
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">

</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	significant reductions in capital spending budgets of our customers; and
</FONT>
</P>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	a pessimistic outlook for the price of oil and natural gas.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Although we determined there were no impairments in 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, significant decreases in our forecasted sales, particularly with our largest customers, could result in future impairments of our customer base intangible assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	The carrying value of property, plant and equipment as of December 31, 2016 was $135 million, or 6% of total assets.&nbsp;&nbsp;This amount was comprised of $92 million, $20 million and $23 million in our U.S., Canada and International
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	segments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;We group property, plant and equipment and evaluate it
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	for recoverability at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	a country or regional level.&nbsp;&nbsp;We determine t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	he fair value of property, plant and equipment based on appraisal procedures which involve both market and cost techniques depending on the nature of the specific assets and the availability of market information.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2016, no indicators of property, plant and equipment impairment were present.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on the nature of our property, plant and equipment and the reduction in carrying value each year through depreciation, we believe future impairments are not likely.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	When testing for the impairment of the value of long-lived assets, we make forecasts of:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:21PT;">

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TD>

	our future operating results,
